maml:description.maml:para: Add document objects
This is the Description section
The Add-IshDocumentObj cmdlet adds the new document object(s) (which include illustrations) that are passed through the pipeline or determined via provided parameters
This commandlet allows to create all types of objects (Illustrations, Maps, etc. ), except for publication (outputs). For publication (outputs) you need to use Add-IshPublicationOutput.
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
The identifier of the folder where the new object will be created
The type of the new object
The logical identifier of the new object
The version of the new object
The language of the new object
The resolution of the new object
The metadata to set for the new object
The unique identifier of the Electronic Document Type for the content (e.g. EDTPDF, EDTXML, EDTHTML,...) of the new object
The location of the file on the filesystem containing content (xml, jpg, etc.) for the new object
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
The identifier of the folder where the new object will be created
The type of the new object
The logical identifier of the new object
The version of the new object
The language of the new object
The resolution of the new object
The metadata to set for the new object
The unique identifier of the Electronic Document Type for the content (e.g. EDTPDF, EDTXML, EDTHTML,...) of the new object
String containing file content (xml) for the new object
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
The identifier of the folder where the new object will be created
Array with the objects to create. This array can be passed through the pipeline or explicitly passed via the parameter.
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
The identifier of the folder where the new object will be created
The type of the new object
The logical identifier of the new object
The version of the new object
The language of the new object
The resolution of the new object
The metadata to set for the new object
The unique identifier of the Electronic Document Type for the content (e.g. EDTPDF, EDTXML, EDTHTML,...) of the new object
The location of the file on the filesystem containing content (xml, jpg, etc.) for the new object
String containing file content (xml) for the new object
Array with the objects to create. This array can be passed through the pipeline or explicitly passed via the parameter.
The IshObject array that holds all information about the object(s) added

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Add Module without providing LogicalId and Version --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# Add Module without providing LogicalId and Version
Import-Module ISHRemote -Force $ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "" -IshUserPassword ""
Write-Host "`r`nCreate a logical, version, language level" $ditaFilePath = "c:\temp\Task.dita" # Template which is used to create a language level $ishMetadataFields = Set-IshValueField -Name "FTITLE" -Level "Logical" -Value "Example ISHModule" ` | Set-IshValueField -Name "FCHANGES" -Level "Version" -Value "Changes text field" ` | Set-IshValueField -Name "FSTATUS" -Level "Lng" -Value "Draft" ` | Set-IshValueField -Name "FAUTHOR" -Level "Lng" -Value "admin" # add object $ishObject = Add-IshDocumentObj -IshSession $ishSession ` -FolderId "0" ` #use valid FolderId -IshType "ISHModule" ` -Lng "en" ` -Metadata $ishMetadataFields ` -Edt "EDTXML" ` -FilePath $ditaFilePath
$ishObject.ObjectRef| Format-Table

dev:remarks.maml:para:
Create a logical, version, language level
Key Value --- ----- Logical 685925 Version 685926 Lng 685927

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Add Module with providing LogicalId and Version --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# Add Module with providing LogicalId and Version
Import-Module ISHRemote -Force $ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "" -IshUserPassword ""
Write-Host "`r`nCreate a logical, version, language level" $timestamp = get-date -Format "yyyyMMddHHmmss" $logicalId = "MYGUID-$timestamp" $ditaFilePath = "c:\temp\Task.dita" # Template which is used to create a language level $ishMetadataFields = Set-IshValueField -Name "FTITLE" -Level "Logical" -Value "Example ISHModule" ` | Set-IshValueField -Name "FCHANGES" -Level "Version" -Value "Changes text field" ` | Set-IshValueField -Name "FSTATUS" -Level "Lng" -Value "Draft" ` | Set-IshValueField -Name "FAUTHOR" -Level "Lng" -Value "admin" # add object $ishObject = Add-IshDocumentObj -IshSession $ishSession ` -FolderId "0" ` #use valid FolderId -LogicalId $logicalId ` -IshType "ISHModule" ` -Version "1" ` -Lng "en" ` -Metadata $ishMetadataFields ` -Edt "EDTXML" ` -FilePath $ditaFilePath
$ishObject.ObjectRef| Format-Table

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add a Module into a provided Folder. LogicalId and Version are defined and provided in the PowerShell script

Create a logical, version, language level
Key Value --- ----- Logical 685925 Version 685926 Lng 685927

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Add Module without providing LogicalId, Version and using FileContent parameter --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# Add Module without providing LogicalId, Version and using FileContent parameter
Import-Module ISHRemote -Force $ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "" -IshUserPassword ""
Write-Host "`r`nCreate a logical, version, language level" $ditaFileContent = @" <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Task//EN" "task.dtd"> <task> <title>Enter the title of your task here.</title> <shortdesc>Enter a short description of your task here (optional).</shortdesc> <taskbody> <prereq>Enter the prerequisites here (optional).</prereq> <context>Enter the context of your task here (optional).</context> <steps> <step><cmd>Enter your first step here.</cmd><stepresult>Enter the result of your step here (optional).</stepresult></step> </steps> <example>Enter an example that illustrates the current task (optional).</example> <postreq>Enter the tasks the user should do after finishing this task (optional).</postreq> </taskbody> </task> "@ $ishMetadataFields = Set-IshValueField -Name "FTITLE" -Level "Logical" -Value "Example ISHModule" ` | Set-IshValueField -Name "FCHANGES" -Level "Version" -Value "Changes text field" ` | Set-IshValueField -Name "FSTATUS" -Level "Lng" -Value "Draft" ` | Set-IshValueField -Name "FAUTHOR" -Level "Lng" -Value "admin" # add object $ishObject = Add-IshDocumentObj -IshSession $ishSession ` -FolderId "0" ` -IshType "ISHModule" ` -Lng "en" ` -Metadata $ishMetadataFields ` -Edt "EDTXML" ` -FileContent $ditaFileContent
$ishObject.ObjectRef| Format-Table

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Add a new EDT --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword"
$metadata = Set-IshValueField -Name "EDT-CANDIDATE" -Level "none" -Value "XML" ` |Set-IshValueField -Name "EDT-FILE-EXTENSION" -Level "none" -Value "XML" ` |Set-IshValueField -Name "EDT-MIME-TYPE" -Level "none" -Value "text/xml" $edt = Add-IshEDT -IshSession $ishSession ` -Name "MYEDT" ` -Metadata $metadata

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Add a folder using input parameters --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword" $folderName = "New folder created by powershell" $parentFolderId = "7775" # provide a valid parent folder Id $ishFolders = Add-IshFolder -IshSession $ishSession ` -ParentFolderId $parentFolderId ` -FolderType "ISHModule" ` -FolderName $folderName ` -ReadAccess @("") ` -OwnedBy ""

dev:remarks.maml:para: Example creates a folder with name "New folder created by powershell" of the "ISHModule" type under the specified $parentFolderId

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Adding a new output format --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword" $metadata = Set-IshValueField -Name "FISHRESOLUTIONS" -Level "none" -Value "Low" ` |Set-IshValueField -Name "FISHSINGLEFILE" -Level "none" -Value "TRUE" -ValueType Element ` |Set-IshValueField -Name "FISHCLEANUP" -Level "none" -Value "TRUE" -ValueType Element ` |Set-IshValueField -Name "FISHKEEPDTDSYSTEMID" -Level "none" -Value "TRUE" -ValueType Element ` |Set-IshValueField -Name "FISHPUBRESOLVEVARIABLES" -Level "none" -Value "TRUE" -ValueType Element
$outputFormat = Add-IshOutputFormat -IshSession $ishSession ` -Name "MyOutputFormat" ` -EDT "EDTPDF" ` -Metadata $metadata

dev:remarks.maml:para: Example creates Output format with the name "MyOutputFormat". As the result of Add-IshOutputFormat cmd-let execution, IshObject with type "ISHOutputFormat" is piped to $outputFormat variable.

command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword" $metaDataCreate = Set-IshValueField -Name 'FISHFALLBACKLNGDEFAULT' -Level 'lng' -Value 'en' | ` Set-IshValueField -Name 'FISHFALLBACKLNGIMAGES' -Level 'lng' -Value 'en' | ` Set-IshValueField -Name 'FISHFALLBACKLNGRESOURCES' -Level 'lng' -Value 'en'

maml:description.maml:para: Cancel publishing of a publication outputs
This is the Description section
The Cancel-IshPublicationOutput cmdlet cancels publishes of all publication outputs that are passed through the pipeline or determined via provided parameters.
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
The logical identifier of the publication output.
The version of the publication output.
The output format (GUID) of the publication output.
The language combination of the publication output.
The required current metadata of the publication output.
This parameter can be used to avoid that users override changes done by other users.

The cmdlet will check whether the fields provided in this parameter still have the same values in the repository. If the metadata is still the same, the publication output is cancelled. If the metadata is not the same anymore, an error is given and the publication output is not cancelled.
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
Array with the publication outputs to cancel. This array can be passed through the pipeline or explicitly passed via the parameter.
The required current metadata of the publication output.
This parameter can be used to avoid that users override changes done by other users.

The cmdlet will check whether the fields provided in this parameter still have the same values in the repository. If the metadata is still the same, the publication output is cancelled. If the metadata is not the same anymore, an error is given and the publication output is not cancelled.
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
The logical identifier of the publication output.
The version of the publication output.
The output format (GUID) of the publication output.
The language combination of the publication output.
The required current metadata of the publication output.
This parameter can be used to avoid that users override changes done by other users.

The cmdlet will check whether the fields provided in this parameter still have the same values in the repository. If the metadata is still the same, the publication output is cancelled. If the metadata is not the same anymore, an error is given and the publication output is not cancelled.
Array with the publication outputs to cancel. This array can be passed through the pipeline or explicitly passed via the parameter.
An IshObject array that holds all information about the publication outputs that are cancelled.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Cancelling publish of a publication output --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword" $ishobjects = Cancel-IshPublicationOutput -IshSession $ishSession ` -LogicalId "GUID-F66C1BB5-076D-455C-B055-DAC5D61AB3D9" ` -Version "1" ` -OutputFormat "GUID-2A69335D-F025-4963-A142-5E49988C7C0C" ` -LanguageCombination "en"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Cancel publish process of publication output with specified LogicalId, Version, OutputFormat, LanguageCombination parameters $ishobjects variable will contain ISHPublication object that was cancelled

maml:description.maml:para: Find document objects
This is the Description section
The Find-IshDocumentObj cmdlet finds document objects (which include illustrations) using MetadataFilter, TypeFilter and StatusFilter that are provided
This commandlet allows to find all types of objects (Illustrations, Maps, etc. ), except for publication (outputs). For publication (outputs) you need to use Find-IshPublicationOutput.
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
The metadata filter with the filter fields to limit the amount of objects returned
The metadata fields to retrieve
The folder type filter to limit the amount of objects returned. Default is no filtering.
The status type filter to limit the amount of objects returned. Default is no filtering.
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
The metadata filter with the filter fields to limit the amount of objects returned
The metadata fields to retrieve
The folder type filter to limit the amount of objects returned. Default is no filtering.
The status type filter to limit the amount of objects returned. Default is no filtering.
The IshObject array that holds all information about the object(s) found
Find EDTs
This is the Description section
The Find-IshEDT cmdlet finds EDT objects using ActivityFilter and MetadataFilter that are provided
An IshObject array that holds all information about the EDT(s) that are found.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Find EDTs with names containing "edt" text --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword"
$ishFilterFields = Set-IshFilterField -Name "EDT-FILE-EXTENSION" -Level "None" -FilterOperator "Like" -Value "%xml%" $ishRequestedFields = Set-IshField -Name "NAME" -Level "None" $edtList = Find-IshEDT -IshSession $ishSession ` -ActivityFilter "None" ` -MetadataFilter $ishFilterFields ` -RequestedMetadata $ishRequestedFields

dev:remarks.maml:para: Find all EDTs where name contains "edt" and write it to the $edtList variable

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Finding publication outputs --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword" # Set requested metadata $requestedMetadataRetrieve = Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHOUTPUTFORMATREF' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBLNGCOMBINATION' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBSTATUS' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBLISHER' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBSTARTDATE' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBENDDATE' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'VERSION' -Level "Version"
# Set metadata filter $metadataFilterRetrieve = Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBSTATUS' -Level 'Lng' -ValueType "Value" -FilterOperator "Equal" -Value "To Be Published"
# Find publication outputs $publicationOutputs = Find-IshPublicationOutput -IshSession $ishSession -StatusFilter "ishnostatusfilter" -RequestedMetadata $requestedMetadataRetrieve

dev:remarks.maml:para: Find all publication outputs where status equals to "To Be Published"
IshObject array with found publication outputs

Generalizes specialized DITA xml files.
This is the Description section
The Generalize-DitaXml cmdlet generalizes all files that are passed through the pipeline or via the -FileLocation parameter.
Both the specialized input xml file and resulting generalized xml output file are validated.
Note that a DOCTYPE needs to be present in the input xml file and resulting generalized xml output file are validated.
The filepath of the catalog with the specialized DTDs.
Best is to make a separate folders with all the specialized DTD files together + a catalog with relative locations to the specialized DTD files.
The filepath of the catalog with the generalized/standard DTDs.
Best is to make a separate folders with all the generalized DTD files together + a catalog with relative locations to the generalized DTD files.
The location of a generalization mapping file.
This mapping file defines the relation between the specialized dtd rootelements/public ids and the corresponding generalized dtd rootelements/public ids.

It is of the following form: <generalizationcataloglookup> <match rootelement="learningSummary" dtdpublicid="-//OASIS//DTD DITA Learning Summary//EN" generalizedrootelement="topic" generalizeddtdpublicid="-//OASIS//DTD DITA Topic//EN" generalizeddtdsystemid="dita-oasis/1.1/topic.dtd" /> <match rootelement="learningContent" generalizedrootelement="topic" generalizeddtdpublicid="-//OASIS//DTD DITA Topic//EN" generalizeddtdsystemid="dita-oasis/1.1/topic.dtd" /> ... </generalizationcataloglookup>

The rootelement, dtdpublicid or dtdsystemid attributes are used to match the specialized xml rootelement or dtd, while the generalizedrootelement, generalizeddtdpublicid or generalizeddtdsystemid are used to specify the corresponding generalized rootelement/dtd.
Note that: 1) At least one of the specialized attributes is required 2) The generalizedrootelement is required 3) Either the generalizeddtdpublicid or generalizeddtdsystemid is required
Array of attributes that are specialized from the DITA "props" attribute (and need to be generalized to it).
Array of attributes that are specialized from the DITA "base" attribute (and need to be generalized to it).

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet does NOT backup the files provided!

1) If the xml input file can be generalized, the file extension of the original file is change to ".gen"(e.g "<filename>.xml" is changed to "<filename>.gen") and the filename is added to the list of files that is returned from the cmdlet. 2) If the xml input file can NOT be generalized, the file extension of the original file is change to ".err"(e.g "<filename>.xml" is changed to "<filename>.err") and a .log file is put next to with the details of the errors (e.g. "<filename>.log")

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Generalize all DITA xml files in a certain directory --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# This sample script will process all DITA xml files in the input folder and will generalize all DITA files either to Topic or Map. # Note that ditabase and ditaval are not supported. # Note that the xmls in the input folder needs to have a DOCTYPE.
Write-Host "Setting current directory..." [string]$currentScriptDirectory = split-path -parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition Set-Location $currentScriptDirectory [Environment]::CurrentDirectory=$currentScriptDirectory
# Input folder with the specialized xmls to generalize. $inputfolder = "Data-GeneralizeDitaXml\InputFiles" # Output folder with the generalize xmls. The successfully generalized files will get a .gen extension, the failed ones will get .err with a .log file next to them why they failed. $outputfolder = "Data-GeneralizeDitaXml\OutputFiles" # !This folder will be deleted if it already exists!
# Location of the catalog xml that contains the specialized dtds $specializedCatalogLocation = "Data-GeneralizeDitaXml\SpecializedDTDs\catalog-alldita12dtds.xml" # Location of the catalog xml that contains the "base" dtds $generalizedCatalogLocation = "Data-GeneralizeDitaXml\GeneralizedDTDs\catalog-dita12topic&maponly.xml"; # File that contains a mapping between the specialized dtd and the according generalized dtd. $generalizationCatalogMappingLocation = "Data-GeneralizeDitaXml\generalization-catalog-mapping.xml" # If you would have specialized attributes from the DITA 1.2 "props" attribute, specify those attributes here to generalize them to the "props" attribute again. Here just using modelyear, market, vehicle as an example $attributesToGeneralizeToProps = @("modelA", "modelB", "modelC") # If you would have specialized attributes from the DITA 1.2 "base" attribute, specify those attributes here to generalize them to the "base" attribute again. Here just using basea, baseb, basec as an example $attributesToGeneralizeToBase = @("basea", "baseb", "basec")
if (Test-Path $outputfolder) { Remove-Item $outputfolder -Recurse }
# First we will copy all the files of the inputfolder to the outputfolder recursively Copy-Item -Path $inputfolder -Destination $outputfolder -recurse -force
# Read all the xml files to process from the outputfolder $filesToProcess = get-childItem $outputfolder -include *.xml -recurse
# Generalize all the files in the outputfolder # The successfully generalized files will get a .gen extension, the failed ones will get .err with a .log file next to them why they failed. $filesToProcess | Generalize-DitaXml ` -SpecializedCatalogLocation $SpecializedCatalogLocation ` -GeneralizedCatalogLocation $GeneralizedCatalogLocation ` -GeneralizationCatalogMappingLocation $GeneralizationCatalogMappingLocation ` -AttributesToGeneralizeToProps $attributesToGeneralizeToProps ` -AttributesToGeneralizeToBase $attributesToGeneralizeToBase

dev:remarks.maml:para: Generalize all DITA xml files in a certain directory

maml:description.maml:para: Get a configuration settings from the repository
This is the Description section
This cmdlet can be used to get a configuration setting from the repository.

Depending on the parameters you use, the setting will be returned differently. If you provide: * A requested metadata parameter with the fields to get, the setting will be return as IshFields * A fieldname and no filepath, the setting will be returned as string * A fieldname and a filepath, the setting will be saved to the file. If the file is already present, providing -Force will allow you to overwrite the file
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
The settings field to retrieve
File on the Windows filesystem where to save the retrieved setting
When set, will override the file when it already exists

Get the timezone on the server.
This cmdlet returns the time zone information of the web/app server.

This cmdlet can also be used to measure the latency between the client and the server. ClientElapsed - either Min, Average or Max - indicates the time taken to execute the web service call measured from the client. AppServerElapsed - either Min, Average or Max - indicates the time taken to execute the database query measured on the web/app server. DbServerElapsed - either Min, Average or Max - indicates the time taken to execute the database query measured on the database server. By performing multiple calls using the Count parameter you will get a better idea on variation on the calls.
Client and app server network latency is calculated through: ClientElapsed - AppServerElapsed. App server and db server network latency is calculated through: AppServerElapsed - DbServerElapsed.
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
The amount off get timezone webservice call you wish to perform.
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
The amount off get timezone webservice call you wish to perform.
An IshApplicationSettings object that holds information about the timezone and the latency timings.

When the Force switch is set, after deleting the publication output object, the publication version object and publication logical object will be deleted if they don't have any publication outputs anymore. command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Download modules to a temp location --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword" $ishFilterFields = Set-IshFilterField -Name "FTITLE" -Level "Logical" -FilterOperator "Like" -Value "%topic%" | Set-IshFilterField -Name "FAUTHOR" -Level "Lng" -FilterOperator "Equal" -Value "admin" | Set-IshFilterField -Name "FSTATUS" -Level "Lng" -FilterOperator "Equal" -Value "To be translated"
$ishRequestedFields = Set-IShFilterField -Name "FTITLE" -Level "logical" | Set-IShFilterField -Name "VERSION" -Level "version" | Set-IShFilterField -Name "DOC-LANGUAGE" -Level "lng" $fileList = Find-IshDocumentObj -IshSession $ishSession -MetadataFilter $ishFilterFields ` -IshTypeFilter "ISHModule" ` -RequestedMetadata $ishRequestedFields | ` Get-IshDocumentObjData -IshSession $ishSession ` -FolderPath "c:\temp\export"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Download all modules to the "c:\temp\export" folder where Author is "admin", Status is "To be translated" and Title contains "topic"
FileInfo array containing all information on saved objects, including their full name.

command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword"
$metadata = Set-IshValueField -Name "EDT-CANDIDATE" -Level "none" -Value "XML" ` |Set-IshValueField -Name "EDT-FILE-EXTENSION" -Level "none" -Value "XML" ` |Set-IshValueField -Name "EDT-MIME-TYPE" -Level "none" -Value "text/xml" $edt = Add-IshEDT -IshSession $ishSession ` -Name "MYEDT" ` -Metadata $metadata

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the document objects or publication outputs of folders
This is the Description section

The Get-IshFolderContent cmdlet returns all document objects or publication outputs stored inside a given folder. You can provide filters to reduce the amount of objects returned, but if you don't provide any: * The cmdlet will return an object for all the latest versions in all language and resolution for a document object folder * The cmdlet will return an object for all the latest versions for all output formats and all language combinations for a publication folder
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.
Identifier of the folder for which to retrieve the content
The version filter to limit the amount of objects returned. When no filter is supplied, latest version objects will be returned.
The langauges filter to limit the amount of objects returned. When no languages filter is supplied, all object languages will be returned.
The IshSession variable holds the authentication information. This object can be initialized using the New-IshSession cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Retrieving publication outputs --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword"
# Set requested metadata $requestedMetadataRetrieve = Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHOUTPUTFORMATREF' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBLNGCOMBINATION' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBSTATUS' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBLISHER' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBSTARTDATE' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBENDDATE' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'VERSION' -Level "Version"
# Set metadata filter $metadataFilterRetrieve = Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBSTATUS' -Level 'Lng' -ValueType "Value" -FilterOperator "Equal" -Value "Draft"
# Retrieve publication outputs $publicationOutput = Get-IshPublicationOutput -IshSession $ishSession ` -LogicalIds @("GUID-412E3A98-9AA8-484E-A1AA-3DE3B58947BD", "GUID-F66C1BB5-076D-455C-B055-DAC5D61AB3D9") ` -StatusFilter "ishreleasedordraftstates" ` -RequestedMetadata $requestedMetadataRetrieve ` -MetadataFilter $metadataFilterRetrieve

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve publication output(s) as IshObject array with the provided LogicalIds and using filters StatusFilter and MetadataFilter.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Downloading publication outputs --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword"
# Set requested metadata $requestedMetadataRetrieve = Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHOUTPUTFORMATREF' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBLNGCOMBINATION' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBSTATUS' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBLISHER' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBSTARTDATE' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBENDDATE' -Level "Lng" | ` Set-IshFilterField -Name 'VERSION' -Level "Version"
# Set metadata filter $metadataFilterRetrieve = Set-IshFilterField -Name 'FISHPUBSTATUS' -Level 'Lng' -ValueType "Value" -FilterOperator "Equal" -Value "Draft"
# Find publication outputs $publicationOutputs = Find-IshPublicationOutput -IshSession $ishSession -StatusFilter "ishnostatusfilter" -RequestedMetadata $requestedMetadataRetrieve
$fileInfoArray = $publicationOutputs | Get-IshPublicationOutputData -IshSession $ishSession -FolderPath "c:\temp\export"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Find all publication outputs with "Draft" status and download them to the "c:\temp\export" location. $fileInfoArray variable contains all information on the objects that were downloaded.

Update EDTs
This is the Description section
The Set-IshEDT cmdlet updates the EDTs that are passed through the pipeline or determined via provided parameters
An IshObject array that holds all information about the updated EDTs

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Add EDT and update name --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword" $edtName = "MYEDT" $metadata = Set-IshValueField -Name "EDT-CANDIDATE" -Level "none" -Value "XML" ` |Set-IshValueField -Name "EDT-FILE-EXTENSION" -Level "none" -Value "XML" ` |Set-IshValueField -Name "EDT-MIME-TYPE" -Level "none" -Value "text/xml" $edtAdd = Add-IshEDT -IshSession $ishSession ` -Name $edtName ` -Metadata $metadata
$metadataUpdate = Set-IshValueField -Name "NAME" -Level "none" -Value ($edtName + " updated") $requiredCurrentMetadata = Set-IshValueField -Name "EDT-FILE-EXTENSION" -Level "none" -Value "XML" $updatedEdt = $edtAdd[0] | Set-IshFields -MergeFields $metadataUpdate -ValueAction "Overwrite" ` | Set-IshEDT -IshSession $ishSession ` -RequiredCurrentMetadata $requiredCurrentMetadata

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add a new EDT and update its Name property

Create or merge IshFields
This is the Description section

The Set-IshFields cmdlet sets/merges the IshFields * If an IshObject[] array parameter is provided (either explicit or via the pipeline), the MergeFields are merged according to the ValueAction parameter to all the IshFields of all the objects, and the objects are returned * If an IshFields object is provided (either explicit or via the pipeline), the MergeFields are merged according to the ValueAction parameter to the IshFields object and the resulting fields are returned * If none of the above applies, the fields in the MergeFields are returned

command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword"
# Update a publication output $metaDataUpdate = Set-IshValueField -Name 'FISHFALLBACKLNGDEFAULT' -Level 'lng' -Value 'bg' | ` Set-IshValueField -Name 'FISHFALLBACKLNGIMAGES' -Level 'lng' -Value 'bg' | ` Set-IshValueField -Name 'FISHFALLBACKLNGRESOURCES' -Level 'lng' -Value 'bg' Set-IshPublicationOutput -IshSession $ishSession ` -LogicalId "GUID-F66C1BB5-076D-455C-B055-DAC5D61AB3D9" ` -Version "1" ` -OutputFormat "GUID-2A69335D-F025-4963-A142-5E49988C7C0C" ` -LanguageCombination "en" ` -MetaData $metaDataUpdate

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Add and update Value --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ishSession = New-IshSession -WsBaseUrl "https://example.com/InfoShareWS/" -IshUserName "username" -IshUserPassword "userpassword"
$lovValue = Add-IshValue -IshSession $ishSession ` -LovId "DILLUSTRATIONTYPE" ` -Label "New image type" ` -Description "Description" `
$updatedLovValue = Set-IshValue -IshSession $ishSession ` -LovId "DILLUSTRATIONTYPE" ` -LovValueId $lovValue.IshRef ` -Label "Updated new image type" ` -Active $true ` -Description "Updated description"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add a Value into "DILLUSTRATIONTYPE" List Of Values and then update label and description
